00026  * lustre/include/lustre/lustre_lfsck_user.h

00028  * Lustre LFSCK userspace interfaces.

00033 #ifndef _LUSTRE_LFSCK_USER_H
00034 # define _LUSTRE_LFSCK_USER_H
00035 # include <lustre/lustre_user.h>
00036 
00066 enum lfsck_status {
00067         /* The lfsck file is new created, for new MDT, upgrading from old disk,
00068          * or re-creating the lfsck file manually. */
00069         LS_INIT                 = 0,
00070 
00071         /* The first-step system scanning. The checked items during the phase1
00072          * scanning depends on the LFSCK type. */
00073         LS_SCANNING_PHASE1      = 1,
00074 
00075         /* The second-step system scanning. The checked items during the phase2
00076          * scanning depends on the LFSCK type. */
00077         LS_SCANNING_PHASE2      = 2,
00078 
00079         /* The LFSCK processing has completed for all objects. */
00080         LS_COMPLETED            = 3,
00081 
00082         /* The LFSCK exited automatically for failure, will not auto restart. */
00083         LS_FAILED               = 4,
00084 
00085         /* The LFSCK is stopped manually, will not auto restart. */
00086         LS_STOPPED              = 5,
00087 
00088         /* LFSCK is paused automatically when umount,
00089          * will be restarted automatically when remount. */
00090         LS_PAUSED               = 6,
00091 
00092         /* System crashed during the LFSCK,
00093          * will be restarted automatically after recovery. */
00094         LS_CRASHED              = 7,
00095 
00096         /* Some OST/MDT failed during the LFSCK, or not join the LFSCK. */
00097         LS_PARTIAL              = 8,
00098 
00099         /* The LFSCK is failed because its controller is failed. */
00100         LS_CO_FAILED            = 9,
00101 
00102         /* The LFSCK is stopped because its controller is stopped. */
00103         LS_CO_STOPPED           = 10,
00104 
00105         /* The LFSCK is paused because its controller is paused. */
00106         LS_CO_PAUSED            = 11,
00107 
00108         LS_MAX
00109 };
00110 
00111 static inline const char *lfsck_status2name(int status)
00112 {
00113         static const char * const lfsck_status_names[] = {
00114                 [LS_INIT]               = "init",
00115                 [LS_SCANNING_PHASE1]    = "scanning-phase1",
00116                 [LS_SCANNING_PHASE2]    = "scanning-phase2",
00117                 [LS_COMPLETED]          = "completed",
00118                 [LS_FAILED]             = "failed",
00119                 [LS_STOPPED]            = "stopped",
00120                 [LS_PAUSED]             = "paused",
00121                 [LS_CRASHED]            = "crashed",
00122                 [LS_PARTIAL]            = "partial",
00123                 [LS_CO_FAILED]          = "co-failed",
00124                 [LS_CO_STOPPED]         = "co-stopped",
00125                 [LS_CO_PAUSED]          = "co-paused"
00126         };
00127 
00128         if (status < 0 || status >= LS_MAX)
00129                 return "unknown";
00130 
00131         return lfsck_status_names[status];
00132 }
00133 
00134 enum lfsck_param_flags {
00135         /* Reset LFSCK iterator position to the device beginning. */
00136         LPF_RESET               = 0x0001,
00137 
00138         /* Exit when fail. */
00139         LPF_FAILOUT             = 0x0002,
00140 
00141         /* Dryrun mode, only check without modification */
00142         LPF_DRYRUN              = 0x0004,
00143 
00144         /* LFSCK runs on all targets. */
00145         LPF_ALL_TGT             = 0x0008,
00146 
00147         /* Broadcast the command to other MDTs. Only valid on the sponsor MDT */
00148         LPF_BROADCAST           = 0x0010,
00149 
00150         /* Handle orphan OST-objects. */
00151         LPF_OST_ORPHAN          = 0x0020,
00152 
00153         /* Create OST-object for dangling LOV EA. */
00154         LPF_CREATE_OSTOBJ       = 0x0040,
00155 
00156         /* Create MDT-object for dangling name entry. */
00157         LPF_CREATE_MDTOBJ       = 0x0080,
00158 
00159         /* Do not return until the LFSCK not running. */
00160         LPF_WAIT                = 0x0100,
00161 };
00162 
00163 enum lfsck_type {
00164         /* For MDT and OST internal OSD consistency check/repair. */
00165         LFSCK_TYPE_SCRUB        = 0x0000,
00166 
00167         /* For MDT-OST (layout, object) consistency check/repair. */
00168         LFSCK_TYPE_LAYOUT       = 0x0001,
00169 
00170         /* For MDT (FID-in-dirent, linkEA) consistency check/repair. */
00171         LFSCK_TYPE_NAMESPACE    = 0x0004,
00172         LFSCK_TYPES_SUPPORTED   = (LFSCK_TYPE_SCRUB | LFSCK_TYPE_LAYOUT |
00173                                    LFSCK_TYPE_NAMESPACE),
00174         LFSCK_TYPES_DEF         = LFSCK_TYPES_SUPPORTED,
00175         LFSCK_TYPES_ALL         = ((__u16)(~0))
00176 };
00177 
00178 #define LFSCK_VERSION_V1        1
00179 #define LFSCK_VERSION_V2        2
00180 
00181 #define LFSCK_SPEED_NO_LIMIT    0
00182 #define LFSCK_SPEED_LIMIT_DEF   LFSCK_SPEED_NO_LIMIT
00183 #define LFSCK_ASYNC_WIN_DEFAULT 1024
00184 #define LFSCK_ASYNC_WIN_MAX     ((__u16)(~0))
00185 #define LFSCK_TYPE_BITS         16
00186 
00187 enum lfsck_start_valid {
00188         LSV_SPEED_LIMIT         = 0x00000001,
00189         LSV_ERROR_HANDLE        = 0x00000002,
00190         LSV_DRYRUN              = 0x00000004,
00191         LSV_ASYNC_WINDOWS       = 0x00000008,
00192         LSV_CREATE_OSTOBJ       = 0x00000010,
00193         LSV_CREATE_MDTOBJ       = 0x00000020,
00194 };
00195 
00196 /* Arguments for starting lfsck. */
00197 struct lfsck_start {
00198         /* Which arguments are valid, see 'enum lfsck_start_valid'. */
00199         __u32   ls_valid;
00200 
00201         /* How many items can be scanned at most per second. */
00202         __u32   ls_speed_limit;
00203 
00204         /* For compatibility between user space tools and kernel service. */
00205         __u16   ls_version;
00206 
00207         /* Which LFSCK components to be (have been) started. */
00208         __u16   ls_active;
00209 
00210         /* Flags for the LFSCK, see 'enum lfsck_param_flags'. */
00211         __u16   ls_flags;
00212 
00213         /* The windows size for async requests pipeline. */
00214         __u16   ls_async_windows;
00215 };
00216 
00217 struct lfsck_stop {
00218         __u32   ls_status;
00219         __u16   ls_flags;
00220         __u16   ls_padding_1; /* For 64-bits aligned. */
00221         __u64   ls_padding_2;
00222 };
00223 
00224 struct lfsck_query {
00225         __u16   lu_types;
00226         __u16   lu_flags;
00227         __u32   lu_mdts_count[LFSCK_TYPE_BITS][LS_MAX + 1];
00228         __u32   lu_osts_count[LFSCK_TYPE_BITS][LS_MAX + 1];
00229         __u64   lu_repaired[LFSCK_TYPE_BITS];
00230 };
00231 
00232 #endif /* _LUSTRE_LFSCK_USER_H */
